plugin.settings.title: Default Sort: Primary Sort Field
plugin.settings.description: When invoking the default sorting method (/tsd), sort first by this field. Note: a minus in front means sort that key in reverse order. hashtags are for #tags, mentions are for @mentions, priority is the number of !!!'s and content is alphabetical.

plugin.settings.title: Default Sort: Secondary Sort Field
plugin.settings.description: When invoking the default sorting method (/tsd), sort secondly by this field (for all fields in the first sort pass above which were the same). Note: a minus in front means sort that key in reverse order. hashtags are for #tags, mentions are for @mentions, priority is the number of !!!'s and content is alphabetical.

plugin.settings.title: Default Sort: Tertiary Sort Field
plugin.settings.description: When invoking the default sorting method (/tsd), sort thirdly by this field (for all fields in the first sorts pass above which were the same). Note: a minus in front means sort that key in reverse order. hashtags are for #tags, mentions are for @mentions, priority is the number of !!!'s and content is alphabetical.

plugin.settings.title: Include Task Status Heading in Output
plugin.settings.description: For all quick task sorting commands (other than /ts), you can specify whether you want the headings to be in the output or not. Task Status headings are, e.g. 'Open Tasks', 'Completed Tasks’, etc.

plugin.settings.title: Include Primary Sort Key Heading in Output
plugin.settings.description: For all quick task sorting commands (other than /ts), you can specify whether you want the subheadings to be in the output or not. Sort Key headings are, e.g. '#tagA', or '@PersonB', etc.

plugin.settings.title: Eliminate Headings with No Content
plugin.settings.description:
After running this command multiple times, you may end up with widowed headings that have no content underneath. If this is checked, after tasks are sorted, the plugin will delete any third/fourth level headings with no content underneath.
BEWARE: It's pretty smart/careful about what empty headings it deletes, but if you have other empty 4th level headings ending in a colon in your document, don't!

plugin.settings.title: Look only for OPEN/incomplete tasks with >date that has passed
plugin.settings.description: When searching for overdue tasks, only look for tasks that are OPEN/incomplete. If unchecked, it will find/process all lines containing a >date tag, whether plain text lines, list/bullets, or completed items.

plugin.settings.title: When changing overdue tasks to >today, delete the original date
plugin.settings.description: When modifying overdue tasks and adding >today to the task, the default is to replace the pre-existing date with the >today tag. Uncheck this option if you want to add >today but leave the previous date also for posterity.

plugin.settings.title: When reviewing, show UPDATED task
plugin.settings.description:
[Selected] = When reviewing overdue tasks, display the way the task will read after the change to >today.
[UNSELECTED] = Show the task as it exists now in the note

plugin.settings.title: Folders to ignore when searching for overdue tasks
plugin.settings.description: A comma-separated list of folders to ignore when searching for items tagged >date+.

plugin.settings.title: Look only for OPEN/incomplete tasks with >date+
plugin.settings.description: When searching for >date+ tags, only look for tasks that are OPEN/incomplete. If unchecked, it will find/process all lines containing a >date+ tag, whether plain text lines, list/bullets, or completed items.

plugin.settings.title: Folders to ignore when searching for >Date+ Tags
plugin.settings.description: A comma-separated list of folders to ignore when searching for items tagged >date+.

plugin.settings.title: Include Reminder Text in Output
plugin.settings.description: By default, there is text appended to the note reminding you not to add content in the search results (because it will be overwritten). This setting allows you to suppress that instruction if you will remember it on your own.

plugin.settings.title: Default Folder Name
plugin.settings.description: If no filename is provided, a filename will be generated from the search string and the results will be saved in this folder. Setting a filename overrides this setting.

plugin.settings.NOTE: DO NOT CHANGE THE FOLLOWING SETTINGS; ADD YOUR SETTINGS ABOVE ^^^

plugin.settings.title: Log Level
plugin.settings.description: Set how much output will be displayed for this plugin the NotePlan > Help > Plugin Console. DEBUG is the most verbose; NONE is the least (silent)
